header_summary:
Ava Chow announced the availability of Bitcoin Core version v28.1rc1 release candidate binaries for community testing, alongside the source code on GitHub, with detailed preliminary release notes to guide users through the new features and changes. This version, aimed at improving Bitcoin's stability and reliability, is accessible for download and review, marking a critical phase before its official release across the Bitcoin network ([Bitcoin Core's official website](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-28.1/test.rc1/), [GitHub source](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/tree/v28.1rc1), [Release notes](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/v28.1rc1/doc/release-notes.md)).

HubertusVIE explores the economic challenges hindering Bitcoin's adoption as a viable currency, proposing the implementation of a Bitcoin-based Chaumian ecash layer to address issues of volatility and fungibility without altering Bitcoin's core protocol. This approach, coupled with the Lightning Network, aims to transform Bitcoin into a practical medium of exchange by overcoming its economic barriers, with further insights available in an ongoing series ([Bitcoin Dilemma Series](https://blog.bitcr.org/p/the-bitcoin-dilemma-store-of-value-or-medium-of-exchange)).

Ajtowns and jungly delve into technical discussions, with ajtowns critiquing the evaluation of ctv-signet's utility based on narrow metrics and highlighting its role in supporting real-world applications like the Babylon project. Meanwhile, jungly presents a method for managing payments within a network of Mining Service Providers (MSPs) through FROST signatures, emphasizing consensus on share contributions and the implementation of protective measures against DDoS attacks, which could decentralize block template production and enhance the mining framework's resilience ([Signet utility](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/ctv-apo-cat-activity-on-signet/1257/10), [MSP Payment Management](https://www.radpool.xyz/1/stratum.html_verifiable_share_ownership)).

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 28.1 Release Candidate 1 Available
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core version v28.1rc1 release candidate binaries are now available.
- Preliminary release notes published on GitHub highlight updates and enhancements.
- Release candidates are crucial for identifying issues before the final version release.

recent_posts.title: op_CAT vs op_CTV vs XMR
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses Bitcoin's potential as a real economy currency, hindered by volatility.
- It suggests a Bitcoin-based Chaumian ecash layer for practical cash transformation, maintaining core protocols.
- Interested readers can explore an ongoing series on Bitcoin's economic challenges and solutions online.

recent_posts.title: CTV, APO, CAT activity on signet
recent_posts.summary:
- The discussion highlights inadequacies in metrics that overlook ctv-signet's precedential value from a 2022 review.
- Signet's role in enabling real-world application tests, such as the Babylon project, is acknowledged despite skepticism.
- Critiques focus on methodology flaws not capturing specific transaction scripts, underlining signet's importance for 'rare case' testing.

recent_posts.title: Radpool: Decentralised Mining Pool With Futures Contracts For Payouts
recent_posts.summary:
- Managing payments in MSP networks requires consensus on contributions and rates.
- The system uses echo broadcast for accurate payment calculations, bypassing nakamoto consensus.
- It promotes decentralization by allowing MSP competition in block template production.

active_posts.title: Covenants Support - Bitcoin Wiki
active_posts.summary:
- A new initiative seeks Bitcoin developer insights on covenant proposals for a wiki draft.
- The initiative aims to build consensus for soft forks, inviting more contributions to the Bitcoin wiki.
- It emphasizes developer input on OP_CTV to improve pooling methods, aiding towards the next soft fork.

active_posts.title: Difficulty in emulating "weaker" OP_SUCCESS and why it should be a real opcode
active_posts.summary:
- OP_SUCCESS opcode enhances Bitcoin script fraud proofs by marking execution successful immediately.
- Rusty Russell's article recognizes its utility despite the complexity of emulating it through script rewriting.
- Direct implementation of OP_SUCCESS could simplify development, making fraud proof mechanisms more accessible.

active_posts.title: Full Disclosure: "Transaction-Relay Throughput Overflow Attacks against Off-Chain Protocols"
active_posts.summary:
- The report examines a new bitcoin attack affecting lightning channels through transaction-relay jamming.
- It explores the "high overflow" and "low overflow" attack variations, detailing their mechanisms and potential costs.
- Mitigation strategies focus on enhancing resilience against these attacks for lightning node operators and developers.

active_posts.title: Great Consensus Cleanup Revival
active_posts.summary: - The analysis suggests improvements in the Bitcoin protocol, focusing on security and efficiency.  - Proposed changes address timewarp vulnerability, non-SegWit transaction issues, and merkle root calculations.  - Community debate arises over block size reduction, with calls for standardization and cautious change implementation.

active_posts.title: Libbitcoin for Core people
active_posts.summary:
- Eric Voskuil noted Libbitcoin's IBD is up to 15 times faster than Bitcoin Core's.
- Libbitcoin's use of an event-based system and relational database structure enhances its performance.
- Despite advances, Libbitcoin lacks full DoS protection and uses an outdated libsecp version.

active_posts.title: PPLNS with job declaration
active_posts.summary:
- An SV2 extension is being developed to improve mining pool payout transparency and fairness.
- This extension empowers miners to choose transactions and mining jobs with varying fee structures.
- The project, still in development, seeks reviews and contributions to refine the proposed system.

today_in_history_posts.title: Schnorr and taproot (etc) upgrade
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The article outlines four improvements to enhance the Bitcoin system.
- Proposed changes include 33-byte v1 witness addresses and new Schnorr opcodes.
- It suggests OP_SUCCESS upgrades can independently complement schnorr/taproot enhancements.

today_in_history_posts.title: [META] Organization of 1.1 Spec Effort
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Matt Corallo prefers IRC meetings for Lightning updates over regular calls.
- He argues that discussions should occur on GitHub or mailing lists for inclusivity.
- Peter Todd agrees, noting textual communication is more accessible than audio/visual methods.

today_in_history_posts.title: Warnet + Increase Tx Relay Rate
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Accurate mainnet representation requires analyzing transaction dynamics and network configuration effects.
- Experiments with 250 nodes using Docker demonstrate the feasibility of simulating mainnet conditions.
- Desired outcomes focus on understanding bandwidth, CPU usage, mempool turnover, and transaction propagation impacts.
